page.title: 14THE COMMUNITY OF FOOTDEE
page.content: Located to the east of Pocra Quay and surrounded by the oil bases is the picturesque village of Footdee, colloquially known as 'Fitty'.This Lilliputian 19th Century 'model village'of single storey but and ben cottages,laid out around four squares, still maintains its primitive charm despite conceding to renovations.To try and protect the character of this Conservation Area the Council has undertaken much of the modernisation work in an effort to prevent piecemeal development.However locals now make minor alterations often without the required permission.They argue Fitty is being turned into'a museum for trendies to visit'or that others are trying to make them live in the past. Having survived the onslaught of oil Fitty's problem are the proverbial conflicts associated with Heritage.
